html: Still, many Americans experience housing discrimination. We must ensure enforcement of the law, and make sure it protects all from discrimination.
text: Still, many Americans experience housing discrimination. We must ensure enforcement of the law, and make sure it protects all from discrimination.

html: On this day in 1968, President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the Fair Housing Act into law. This historic legislation outlawed the refusal to sell or rent a dwelling on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, disability, family status, or national origin.
text: On this day in 1968, President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the Fair Housing Act into law. This historic legislation outlawed the refusal to sell or rent a dwelling on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, disability, family status, or national origin.

html: The Port of Houston pays $75-$100 million each year into the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund (HMT), but gets back only $40 million for essential maintenance for dredging. It’s important we modernize the HMT so that ports, including Houston, get the maintenance money they need.
text: The Port of Houston pays $75-$100 million each year into the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund (HMT), but gets back only $40 million for essential maintenance for dredging. It’s important we modernize the HMT so that ports, including Houston, get the maintenance money they need.

html: And it’s not just Texas. Closing the border will negatively affect large sectors of the American economy. While we need to address border security and immigration matters, closing the border is simply not a responsible way to address these important issues.
text: And it’s not just Texas.  Closing the border will negatively affect large sectors of the American economy.  While we need to address border security and immigration matters, closing the border is simply not a responsible way to address these important issues.

html: Closing the United States-Mexico border is not a solution — it is a problem. In Texas alone, trade with Mexico represents an estimated $180 billion each year—and more than a third of Texas’ exports.https://www.chron.com/news/texas/article/More-officers-may-be-reassigned-to-help-border-13732303.php …

html: "[A]bout this there can and should be no argument: Every American citizen must have an equal right to vote. There is no reason which can excuse the denial of that right. There is no duty which weighs more heavily on us than the duty we have to ensure that right.”

text:
The same holds true for bigotry in all forms, and we must work together to combat it wherever we see it.

I am privileged to represent many Muslims in TX-07, and I am proud to do so.

html: Tonight, I voted in favor of the bipartisan, bicameral government spending bill. It's not perfect, it is a compromise that will responsibly fund the government and keep it working #ForThePeople. Our constituents sent us here to work together, and that is what we have done.
text:
Tonight, I voted in favor of the bipartisan, bicameral government spending bill. It's not perfect, it is a compromise that will responsibly fund the government and keep it working #ForThePeople.

Our constituents sent us here to work together, and that is what we have done.

html: Democrats have made clear we support smart, effective border security solutions: increased infrastructure investments, advanced technology to scan for contraband, more customs personnel, and more immigration judges.

html: There is much to discuss on border security matters but this is not the way to do it. We cannot run our government by shutting it down. And we cannot protect our country by hurting the very people who have made it their life’s work to work for us.

html: But I do. And I will work with my colleagues to end the shutdown and mitigate the damage in #TX07 and across the country – and we are already working on ways to do that.
text: But I do.  And I will work with my colleagues to end the shutdown and mitigate the damage in #TX07 and across the country – and we are already working on ways to do that.

html: The impacts of this shutdown are real, and lasting. And it appears that the Senate and the White House do not care.
text: The impacts of this shutdown are real, and lasting. And it appears that the Senate and the White House do not care.

html: There may be reasons, but they are not good reasons. They are political reasons. They are partisan reasons. They are exactly the reasons I and so many others sought to join this Congress and do things differently.
text: There may be reasons, but they are not good reasons.  They are political reasons.  They are partisan reasons.  They are exactly the reasons I and so many others sought to join this Congress and do things differently.

html: Since then, we have continued to act to re-open government, passing multiple individual Senate Republican appropriations bills to re-open all government agencies. There is no good reason that the Senate has not done the same.
text: Since then, we have continued to act to re-open government, passing multiple individual Senate Republican appropriations bills to re-open all government agencies. There is no good reason that the Senate has not done the same.

html: And, to be clear, the new Democratic House passed Senate Republican legislation to end the shutdown, re-open government and secure our borders the day we were sworn in.
text: And, to be clear, the new Democratic House passed Senate Republican legislation to end the shutdown, re-open government and secure our borders the day we were sworn in.

html: The House has passed the legislation to re-open the government. It is past time for the Senate to do the same.
text: The House has passed the legislation to re-open the government.  It is past time for the Senate to do the same.

html: Today, for the 26th day in a row, they are doing so without pay. This is unconscionable.
